{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3164062,"name":"","username":"Hey_its_Bryan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/d6d6ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T01:09:36.014Z","cooked":"

Hello team 9172 here, our roborio used to power on while being connected to the power distribution hub but not it wont turn on, is there a way to fix it?

20230313_1805571920×865 201 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2023-03-14T01:09:36.014Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":105.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":430168,"topic_slug":"roborio-not-powering","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/6/7/67b865703b0f5121ade7c6fbe961722c284ab802.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57170,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio-not-powering/430168/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3164069,"name":"","username":"SammyPants","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sammypants/{size}/188763_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T01:18:39.992Z","cooked":"

is your rio dead?
did you fry the breaker that the rio is connected to?
did the connection come lose?
is the wire disconnected somewhere between the pdh and the rio?
those are what come to mind of why that could be not turning on

The Rio is plugged into slot 20 on the PDH. If you look at the PDH, that slot has an LED light on which means either the fuse isn’t pushed down enough or the fuse is blown and you need a new one. (Since this is a photo, its possible that the light is blinking. If it’s blinking the fuse is probably fine. I would double check the connector on the Rio instead)
